reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OMG! I love it!!
reviews.reviewText: This book is a page-turner! I love dark stories, and this is definitely dark, yet intriguing and addictive! I want it to have a happy ending, yet the way the first book has ended, I'm not sure it's possible, which is why I'm buying and starting the second book right NOW, immediately after finishing the first!! If you like dark stories that have you deeply invested in the story and characters, these books are for you! ❤️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: All along from like 80% on I was like... how is this going to end in 20%, how are all of these things going to happen in order for me to be happy with the result?It doesn't. It was 2am and I finished it and D**N IT, I did not have the energy to find the second and download it before falling asleep.I am hooked on Hayden and Callie. Trying not to compare to other books similar to this one, I really really think the plot is tense and makes me not want to put the book down. They are addicted to each other and try so hard to not be at the same time. The mutual pining has my heart fluttering."I could come from just watching her. But when she moans my name, I nearly explode. And almost crash my car."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Had a lot of potential but with enough small issues what I could only give it 3.5 stars.First of all, the book was amazing until 50% then it kind of started to go off the rails.Calistas character felt inconsistent. At times she was a timid, shy, socially awkward and inexperienced young girl. Other times she was a witty and snarky adult woman with a good up bringing and a Senator for a father. It was like she had two different personalities and they didn’t mesh.Then this girl - who’s so timid she can’t even talk to a somewhat pushy coffee store customer - gets a job as a half-naked bartender in a B-rate Hooters-esque bar? No, just no.The stalking never got intense or angsty or… thrilling. Her reaction was “meh… I think I have a stalker”. Okayyyy. At no point was she scared for her life or did I feel a sense of uneasiness about the events happening. The writer could have made it so much more interesting.The interactions between Hayden and Calista started out great, but quickly delved into insta love territory, and the worst part was her self-depreciating inner turmoil about not being good enough. Towards the end the inner monologues got tedious. I just would rather action and dialogue drive the plot more than thoughts.The whole “I own you now” situation - while I typically love it, there is nothing better than a growly, dominant MMC - it just felt off. I was rolling my eyes over some of the interactions.On top of it all, for a stalker romance it was only mildly spicy. Granted I just got done reading a bunch of Penelope Douglas - aka the Queen of morally grey MMCs - so that has undoubtedly colored my opinion. I could only give it 2🌶️.The book had a lot of potential but it kind of fell flat. I’m debating if I want to read the second book just to see how the cliffhanger resolved.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The hype is real
reviews.reviewText: I’m sometimes skeptical when I see a book being heavily marketed on BookTok but I had to know if the hype was real and IT IS.This story is full of shock, spice and secrets.I’m soooo excited to finish Hayden and Callie’s story.The pearl necklace 🤭Are Callie and the mother connected?Is her father really innocent?Ohhh, sooooo many questions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars vigilante lawyer “follower” meets victims daughter
reviews.reviewText: This is book one of a duet, and though I found the first 30% hard to get into after that it takes off and doesn’t stop I finished this book and the next in a day. I thoroughly enjoyed this book she is the survivor trying to find the truth while hiding her own secrets while he is nothing but honest in his own way and the lawyer who wins regardless of the law says he does. He will stop at nothing to do everything for her, but what he leaves out may not end well for them. Definitely worth the read it hits on dark topics, but it’s overly graphic like some dark romances can be. And the spice is good too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jeez let me just review.
reviews.reviewText: Omgoshh! First, I want to say I love Harper she’s the best friend a girl can ask for. Protective, loving, funny, chaotic. Hayden, I do love how he progresses in the story. The love he feels for Calista is very real and the need to make her know how much he loves her is good. Calista, I love how she is strong and independent and sassy but cowers due to her trauma. I want to see how she progresses!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: All hail daddy Hayden BennetThis turned out to be my new favorite stalker romance! I read it in 6hrs,I'm not the type to annotate books but I will definitely bere-reading and doing just that!5/5*4/5.Please check tw!* Touch her & die* Stalker* Morally grey MMC* Murder* He falls first

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars This book is ok just not for me!
reviews.reviewText: H-Gerard Butler (Hayden Bennett)h-Calista GreenI'm a little confused about this story. So we have Calista who just lost her dad (a senator) he was murdered and it seems he was murdered by Hayden since that's what it tells us in the 1st chapter while he is slowly becoming obsessed with her. So we have a very wealthy lawyer who is also a murderer and we are supposed to "like" this main character who not only kills people but possibly made a mistake and kills Calista dad in error. Yea no. I get this story is a "stalker" type of story but I feel like she is just too dumb. Her dad is wealthy and she spent all that money on clearing out his name and now she is not only poor but dirt poor. I don't get it. The story I feel is very well written is just too boring and a lot of internal thoughts that make no sense sometimes. I really gave this book a shot but I just couldn't continue it. I stopped at 73% chapter 33. I know that this book ends in a cliffhanger so it is not like I'm going to be getting a happy ending on this book. I just don't want to waste my time.

I love the whole story and how it went through. I wont spoil it but there is one pretty good part that really got me😆😏. I highly recommend getting the second on after reading this and of course it depends on the genre preferences and if ur looking to try reading something like this then u found the right book to start with. ITS WORTH IT! 🫣😍

Parece uma grande fanfic do wattapad, não é ruim mas não é bom, bem mediano e até agora não consegui gostar muito dele.O livro é curto então não foi cansativo para a história que ele conta, indo pro segundo...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’m not even sure how I come across this book but I’m glad I did because I really enjoyed this one. I loved how possessive Hayden was from the very start, loved how he took no crap when it came to Calista. I was very nervous how it was going to play out with all the many secrets he is keeping from her. I loved how sneaky Hayden was. Not much spice but when it hit it was good 🤭Harper did annoy me quite a bit in this one, I just felt like her ‘humour’ was really forced and it made me roll my eyes more than made me laugh. I did like how she had Calistas back constantly.This book has it all for a dark romance- serial unaliver is a lawyer- stalking- possessive MMCDefinitely give this duet a read 🔥
great book a must must read book, very very gripping and the story with a piece of reality is amazing
This book has a great story line, an it got me intrigued. I Still have Questions that need answers. Off to read book 2.
